ACG.word_requests¶

ACG.word_requests.words¶

Implementation of Word.

class ACG.word_requests.words.Word(search_term: str = '', word_type: str = '', gender: str = '', examples: list = [], explanations: list = [], synonyms: list = [], antonyms: list = [], translations: list = [], trans_syns: list = [], image_urls: list = [], audio_url: str = '', add_info_dict: dict = {}, conj_table_html: str = '', data_dir: str = 'data', from_lang: str = 'pt', to_lang: str = 'de')[source]¶

Bases: object

Class that fetches and edits the data that makes up the choices, presented to the user in the card-generation process.

Main function is search() function.

search_term: str = None¶
word_type: str = None¶
gender: str = None¶
examples: list = None¶

property audio_url¶

Getter function for _audio_url

search_term_utf8()[source]¶
Returns

search_term with special characters replaced.

folder()[source]¶

Used as folder name to save files to.

Returns

:method:`search_term_utf8` with spaces replaced by underscores.

translate(string)[source]¶

Translates string from from_lang to to_lang.

Returns

Translated string.

request_data()[source]¶

Iterates through parsers and passes results to update_from_dict()

update_from_dict(attr_dict)[source]¶

Iterates through attr_dict and updates Word attributes.

If the value is a list, it extends the original list, else the value is set to the value of attr_dict

Parameters

attr_dict – Each key should be the name of an attribute of Word, the value corresponds to the updated value.

add_translations()[source]¶

For the attributes [“examples”, “synonyms”, “antonyms”], it iterates to the corresponding lists and adds translations, where none are already present.

request_img_urls(keywords=None)[source]¶
Parameters

keywords – String for image search. (Default value = None) If not set, defaults to search_term.

Returns

List of img_urls.

mark_examples()[source]¶

Highlights the search_word in the example sentences using css.

classmethod from_json(path)[source]¶

Initializes Word from dictionary saved as .json.

save_as_json(path=None)[source]¶

Saves class attributes as dictionary in a .json-file.

Parameters

path – If None, is set to f”data/{self.folder()}/{self.folder()}.json” (Default value = None)

search(new_search_term)[source]¶

If possible loads from previously saved search. If not, uses the parsers to obtain info and adds translations, then saves the result for future searches.

Parameters

new_search_term –
